head.supplied: 8/9/79 ¶ ¶ Herewith, dear Professor, I beg to submit the new map of the Nickol-Bay district ¶ to you, prepared by the celebrated traveler Mr John Forrest, ¶ whose extensive geographic expedition wi...

div.p: Arquivo Histórico do Museu Bocage, Universidade de Lisboa, Lisbon.

Herewith, dear Professor, I beg to submit the new map of the Nickol-Bay district
WA. to you, prepared by the celebrated traveler Mr John Forrest,
Presumably Western Australia. Northern district from De Grey River to Ashburton River. As surveyed by John Forrest... (Perth, 1878). Item not seen: the citation is based on the entry in the Royal Geographical Society Library catalogue, no. 'mr Australia S.139'. whose extensive geographic expedition will be well known to you. Mr Forrest, on my request, has named one of the new mountains in honor of His Excellency Don José da Silva Mendes Leal, the Minister of Portugal for the Colonies.

Altho' this is only a small tribute, yet it is one as lasting as the present creation, and we hope here, that his Excellency will be gratifies to see his name as the Colonial Representant of the Portuguese Kingdom identifies with a feature in the Australian Continent for all times.
Perhaps the Geographic Society of Lisbon would show Mr Forrest the honor of electing him a member.
